sentences.sContent: The club gave him an ultimatum – either he apologized, or he would be expelled from the team.
sentences.sCn: 俱乐部给他下了最后通牒——要么道歉，要么等着被开除出队。

sentences.sContent: The army issued an ultimatum for all weapons in the city to be surrendered on October 26th.
sentences.sCn: 军队发出最后通牒，必须于 10 月 26 日交出该市的全部武器。

synos.tran: 最后通牒；最后结论；基本原理

remMethod.val: ultim(最后的) + a + tum(看作term， 期限) → 最后的期限 → 最后通牒

trans.tranOther: a threat saying that if someone does not do what you want by a particular time, you will do something to punish them
